benchmark_details.name: MAPWise
benchmark_details.overview: MAPWise is a novel map-based question-answering benchmark, consisting of maps from three geographical regions (United States, India, China), each containing 1,000 questions designed to test models on their understanding of choropleth maps.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate and encourage research in the area of visual-language models' question-answering capabilities regarding map data.

data.source: Data collected from reliable sources including the Reserve Bank of India, Kaiser Family Foundation, and the National Bureau of Statistics of China.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on exact match criteria for binary and count answers, with recall for single-word answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better model performance. Significant performance gaps identified between model outputs and human baselines.
methodology.baseline_results: Human evaluation results provided a benchmark for model performance comparison.
methodology.validation: Human validation was performed for accuracy verification.
